sentences.english: The new bridge over the railroad tracks eliminated danger in cros, sing.
sentences.chinese: 這座新垮越鐵軌的橋免除了越過鐵軌時的危險。

sentences.english: The new bridge over the railroad tracks eliminated danger in cros, sing.
sentences.chinese: 這座新垮越鐵軌的橋免除了越過鐵軌時的危險。

sentences.english: All the way in the train the rails kept singing, "You're going to see Daddy-Long-Legs."
sentences.chinese: 一路上，鐵軌都在唱着“你就要見到長腿叔叔了。”

sentences.english: Driver was killed, van overturned on the tracks also.
sentences.chinese: 司機被打死了，囚車也翻倒在鐵軌上。

sentences.english: Once on the track, they proceeded in the direction of their own home.
sentences.chinese: 上了鐵軌，她們開始朝家的方向走去。

sentences.english: But you will wind up killing one person walking on the other track.
sentences.chinese: 但你就會殺掉走在另一條鐵軌上的那一個人。

sentences.english: The hooter was ululant; the rail clattered;
Sometimes because of some nearby utility lines, they have to build rails bending.
sentences.chinese: 有時候因爲附近有些公用線路，他們建立了彎曲鐵軌。

sentences.english: The insurgents blow up railway tracks, seize land and chase away forest guards.
sentences.chinese: 起義者炸燬了鐵軌，奪去了土地，趕走了森林警衛。

sentences.english: At the railway stations, the platform usually faces many tracks.
sentences.chinese: 在車站裏站臺一般面朝許多鐵軌。

sentences.english: It was washed right off the tracks and swept out to sea.
sentences.chinese: 火車被直接從鐵軌上衝到海里。

sentences.english: This track was laid down last year,but now it is in need repair.
sentences.chinese: 這條鐵軌是去年鋪成的，可現在卻需要修復。

sentences.english: "Fish Numen" Two people, abandoned platform, rusted rails, where is this place?
sentences.chinese: 兩個人，廢棄的站臺，鏽蝕的鐵軌，這是什麼地方？

sentences.english: As you see, there are no rails in the tunnel.
sentences.chinese: 就像你看到的這樣，隧道中沒有鐵軌。

sentences.english: The battalion commander lined his men along the railway.
sentences.chinese: 營長命令兵士們沿鐵軌排開。

sentences.english: Looking back at the crossing point across the tracks.
sentences.chinese: 回頭看穿過鐵軌要經過的“斷牆”。

definition: Tianqiao district of Jinan city 濟南市|济南市[Ji3 nan2 shi4], Shandong/Tianqiao district in Beijing, formerly a center of folk culture
car window/window of vehicle (bus, train etc)
